column4: Guys, I'm having trouble booting up Ubuntu on my old Dell. Is there any way I can put it on several floppy disks and boot from those?
what's the problem?
what version?
How do I check? I just used "sudo apt-get install gaim"
go to About in gaim
I don't think the true latest version is in the repos.
How can I install the latest version?
you can find deb packages if you google
Error: conflicts with installed package gaim
you have to uninstall gaim first. (don't be afraid of uninstalling ubuntu-desktop, too, it's just a metapackage.)
How can I uninstall it?
Sorry for my noobishness.
in Synaptic, probably Add/Remove, or just "sudo apt-get remove gaim"
Another error... "Dependency is not satisfiable : gaim-data"
wherever you downloaded the deb should also have that
they split it into two packages.
Have done so, same error.
what?
Should I be running gaim-data?
erm... you should download the gaim-data package, install it, then install the gaim package
Thanks, I'll try that.
no prob.
